description: Lists the existing state machines. If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token expires after 24 hours. Using an expired pagination token will return an HTTP 400 InvalidToken error.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results that are returned per call. You can use nextToken to obtain further pages of results. The default is 100 and the maximum allowed page size is 1000. A value of 0 uses the default. This is only an upper limit. The actual number of results returned per call might be fewer than the specified maximum.

nested_items.name: stateMachineArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the state machine.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the state machine.

nested_items.name: creationDate
nested_items.description: The date the state machine is created.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token expires after 24 hours. Using an expired pagination token will return an HTTP 400 InvalidToken error.
